snippet: Nik Wallenda, the seventh-generation stunt performer, successfully walked on a tightrope over Niagara Falls on Friday night.
abstract: Nik Wallenda becomes the first man to walk over the Niagara Gorge in 116 years, and the first ever to walk directly over the falls, as he successfully crosses on a tightrope in front of roughly 100,000 spectators broadcast on a televised ABC special.

byline.original: By DANNY HAKIM and LIZ LEYDEN
byline.contributor: Danny Hakim reported from Niagara Falls, Ontario, and Liz Leyden from Niagara Falls, N.Y.

lead_paragraph: Nik Wallenda, the seventh-generation stunt performer, successfully walked on a tightrope over Niagara Falls on Friday night.

headline.seo: Wallenda’s Niagara Falls Tightrope Walk Stirs Excitement
headline.main: Daredevil Takes a Successful Walk Across a Popular Void
headline.print_headline: Daredevil Takes A Tethered Walk Across a Popular Void
